Example

Given that a note has a frequency of \(20\)Hz, write down the equation of the corresponding graph that models this note.

Solution

We have seen that a single note is modelled by a sine wave and therefor the equation of the graph has the from \(y = \sin bx\). Recall that the value of \(b\) affects the period of the sine wave by the relationship \(\frac{360^\circ}{b}\) and that we know that the period is the reciprocal of the frequency. Hence \[ \mbox{period} = \frac{1}{\mbox{frequency}} = \frac{1}{20} = \frac{360^\circ}{b}. \] Therefore rearranging gives \(b = 7200^\circ\). Hence the equation of the sine wave is \[ y = \sin(7200^\circ x) \]
